description: Create a faster C implementation of portfolio risk and return calculations to replace a Python baseline implementation.

children.description: The Python baseline is located in portfolio_baseline.py.
The baseline calculates portfolio risk and return using nested loops.
Implementation requirements for the C optimization.
Complete the provided skeleton files to create the C implementation.
The skeleton files have TODO markers where code needs to be filled in.
Portfolio risk calculation: sqrt(x^T * S * x) where x = weights, S = covariance matrix.
Portfolio return calculation: x^T * r where r = expected returns.
The results must exactly match the Python baseline within a 1e-10 tolerance.
The implementation must be at least 1.2 times faster than the baseline on portfolios with 5000 or more assets.
The implementation must be able to handle portfolios containing up to 8000 assets.
To build the C extension, run the command `python3 setup.py build_ext --inplace`.
To test the implementation, run `python3 benchmark.py`.
